qas.question: Who was soon allied with Caesar's adopted son following his death?
In what year did the Battle of Philippi end?
What was the alliance that was formed with Marcus Lepidus named?
In what battle did Mark Antony see defeat?

context: After the assassination, <a0_0>Mark Antony<a0_0/> formed an alliance with Caesar's adopted son and great-nephew, Gaius Octavian. Along with Marcus Lepidus, they formed an alliance known as <a3_0>the Second Triumvirate<a3_0/>. They held powers that were nearly identical to the powers that Caesar had held under his constitution. As such, the Senate and assemblies remained powerless, even after Caesar had been assassinated. The conspirators were then defeated at the Battle of Philippi in <a1_0>42 BC<a1_0/>. Eventually, however, Antony and Octavian fought against each other in one last battle. Antony was defeated in the naval <a4_0>Battle of Actium<a4_0/> in 31 BC, and <a2_0>he committed suicide<a2_0/> with his lover, Cleopatra. In 29 BC, Octavian returned to Rome as the unchallenged master of the Empire and later accepted the title of Augustus ("Exalted One"). He was convinced that only a single strong ruler could restore order in Rome.
